cluster_relations.rel_desc: The types of body language represent a categorization scheme applied to body language.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a set of types or a classification scheme specifically used to categorize instances or subtypes of the object concept.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Scope: conceptual taxonomy of body language forms

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Body language is categorized as a form of communication.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific type or modality within the broader class represented by the object.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: used in a variety of ways

args.justification: The relation expresses a subtype/class-membership hierarchy (body language as a specific form of communication). This is best grouped under HIERARCHY rather than IDENTITY, which is more appropriate for strict equivalence or aliasing relations.
args.remark: Aligning with other subtype/taxonomic predicates where rel_cls_group = HIERARCHY.

executed_decisions.justification: The relation expresses a subtype/class-membership hierarchy (body language as a specific form of communication). This is best grouped under HIERARCHY rather than IDENTITY, which is more appropriate for strict equivalence or aliasing relations.
executed_decisions.remark: Aligning with other subtype/taxonomic predicates where rel_cls_group = HIERARCHY.
